original.name: Bright
original.body: When you compare the cosmic deck, add ten additional flares from the unused flare deck.

original.name: Clunkers
original.body: Choose a number from one to five. Each player sends that number of ships to the warp.

original.name: Gemination
original.body:
If the Double Aliens variant is being used, add the Hazard Aliens sub-variant (ðŸ•®18).

Otherwise, add the Double Aliens variant and the Hidden Options sub-variant.

original.name: Generosity
original.body:
If the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) is not being used, add it.

Deal each player one reward card as part of their opening hand.

revised.name: Generosity
revised.body:
If the Reward Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) is not being used, add it.

Deal each player one reward card as part of their starting hand.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for consistency.

original.name: Impoverished
original.body: When each player draws a new hand (including their starting hand), they draw two fewer cards.

original.name: Lo-Tex
original.body:
If the Technology variant is being used, each player discards one of their tech cards.

If the Technology variant (ðŸ•®9) is not being used, each player draws one flare card from the unused flare deck as part of their opening hand.

revised.name: Lo-Tex
revised.body:
If the Technology variant is being used, each player discards one of their tech cards.

If the Technology variant (ðŸ•®9) is not being used, each player draws one flare card from the unused flare deck as part of their starting hand.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for consistency.

original.name: Mutagens
original.body:
If the Evolution variant is being used, reveal two additional evolution cards.

If the Objectives (Array) variant is being used, reveal two additional objective cards.

If neither variant is being used, draw and resolve another wrench card.

revised.name: Mutagens
revised.body:
If the Evolution variant is being used, reveal two additional evolution cards.

If the Array Objectives variant is being used, reveal two additional objective cards.

If neither variant is being used, draw and resolve another wrench card.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited to clarify it affects only the Array Objectives variant, not any other/ objectives variant.

original.name: One More Time
original.body:
Another selection card is drawn and resolved.

Then, each player may replace their currently selected alien with their new alien. All decisions must be announced simultaneously.

revised.name: One More Time
revised.body:
Another age card is drawn and its alien selection method resolved.

Then, each player may replace their currently selected alien with their new alien. All decisions must be announced simultaneously.
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited to fix a reference to a 'selection cards', likely an artefact from early versions.

original.name: Public Option
original.body: Shuffle each age card not in use and reveal one. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player votes "Splup" or "Gwarq". If more players vote "Splup," replace the current age card with the revealed one and resolve its variant's setup instead.

revised_unused.name: Public Option
revised_unused.body: Shuffle each age card not in use and reveal one. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player votes "Splup" or "Gwarq". If more players vote "Splup," replace the current game's age card with the revealed one, remove the replaced age's variant from play and resolve the new age's variant setup instead.
revised_unused.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for clarity.

original.name: Selective Omission
original.body: Shuffle each age card not in use and reveal one. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player votes "Bopf" or "Plark". If more players vote "Bopf," replace the previous age card with the revealed one and resolve its variant's setup instead.

revised_unused.name: Selective Omission
revised_unused.body:
Shuffle each age card not in use and reveal one. Starting with the first player and proceeding clockwise, each player votes "Bopf" or "Plark". If more players vote "Bopf," replace the previous game's age card with the revealed one, remove the replaced age's variant from play and resolve the new age's variant setup instead.

Players that resolved that age's master card reverse its effect and resolve the new age's master card instead.
revised_unused.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for clarity, and to define what happens with the replace age's master card.

original.name: X-Haz
original.body:
If the Hazard Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) is not being used, add it.

Search the hazard deck for Danger Zone and put it into play

revised.name: X-Haz
revised.body:
If the Hazard Deck variant (ðŸ•®10) is not being used, add it.

Search the hazard deck for the "Danger Zone" hazard card and put it into play
revised.revisionNotes:
Revisions from The Praw:

Edited for clarity.
